headline: Texas Instruments to buy chip designer Silicon Labs in $7.5 billion deal
summary: Texas Instruments on Wednesday agreed to buy Silicon Laboratories in a deal valuing the ​chip designer at $7.5 billion, expanding its footprint in ‌wireless connectivity chips used for industrial and consumer applications.  For Texas, whose core ‌strength lies in analog chips that manage signals and power in electronic equipment, the acquisition marks its biggest since the $6.5 billion deal for National Semiconductor in 2011.

content.title: Texas Instruments to buy chip designer Silicon Labs in $7.5 billion deal
content.summary: Texas Instruments on Wednesday agreed to buy Silicon Laboratories in a deal valuing the ​chip designer at $7.5 billion, expanding its footprint in ‌wireless connectivity chips used for industrial and consumer applications.  For Texas, whose core ‌strength lies in analog chips that manage signals and power in electronic equipment, the acquisition marks its biggest since the $6.5 billion deal for National Semiconductor in 2011.

headline: Bitrise Bridges GitHub's Mobile Performance Gap with New Purpose-Built Infrastructure: Bitrise Build Hub
summary: Bitrise, the leading DevOps platform for mobile, announces the launch of its new product, Bitrise Build Hub for GitHub. Build Hub is fully managed, mobile CI infrastructure for GitHub Actions that gives developers access to the fastest MacOS machines (M4 Pro), preconfigured build environments, and automatic Xcode stack updates: all without a complex migration or workflow rewrites.

content.title: Bitrise Bridges GitHub's Mobile Performance Gap with New Purpose-Built Infrastructure: Bitrise Build Hub
content.summary: Bitrise, the leading DevOps platform for mobile, announces the launch of its new product, Bitrise Build Hub for GitHub. Build Hub is fully managed, mobile CI infrastructure for GitHub Actions that gives developers access to the fastest MacOS machines (M4 Pro), preconfigured build environments, and automatic Xcode stack updates: all without a complex migration or workflow rewrites.

headline: Apple App store revenue up 6.3% in fiscal Q2-to-date, says BofA

headline: Silicon Labs Stock Soars. Why Texas Instruments Is Paying a Big Premium for Acquisition.
summary: Texas Instruments  has agreed to buy Silicon Laboratories, a maker of mixed-signal chips used in smart homes, industrial automation, and commercial applications.  Texas Instruments will acquire  Silicon Labs  for $231 per share in an all-cash transaction, representing a total enterprise value of approximately $7.5 billion.  Shares of Silicon Laboratories soared 51% to $206.73 in premarket trading Wednesday.

content.title: Silicon Labs Stock Soars. Why Texas Instruments Is Paying a Big Premium for Acquisition.

Texas Instruments will acquire  Silicon Labs  for $231 per share in an all-cash transaction, representing a total enterprise value of approximately $7.5 billion.  Shares of Silicon Laboratories soared 51% to $206.73 in premarket trading Wednesday.

headline: Texas Instruments strikes $7.5 billion deal for Silicon Labs to boost wireless footprint
summary: Texas Instruments on Wednesday agreed to buy chip designer Silicon Laboratories for about $7.5 billion, aiming to ​expand its presence in wireless connectivity chips used in industrial and ‌consumer applications.  For TI, whose core strength lies in analog chips that manage signals and power ‌in electronic equipment, the acquisition marks its biggest since the $6.5 billion deal for National Semiconductor in 2011.  Unlike AI chip firms Nvidia and AMD, TI focuses on foundational chips used in everyday devices such as smartphones, cars and medical devices, giving ⁠it a large client ‌base that includes Apple, SpaceX and Ford.

content.title: Texas Instruments strikes $7.5 billion deal for Silicon Labs to boost wireless footprint
content.summary: Texas Instruments on Wednesday agreed to buy chip designer Silicon Laboratories for about $7.5 billion, aiming to ​expand its presence in wireless connectivity chips used in industrial and ‌consumer applications.  For TI, whose core strength lies in analog chips that manage signals and power ‌in electronic equipment, the acquisition marks its biggest since the $6.5 billion deal for National Semiconductor in 2011.  Unlike AI chip firms Nvidia and AMD, TI focuses on foundational chips used in everyday devices such as smartphones, cars and medical devices, giving ⁠it a large client ‌base that includes Apple, SpaceX and Ford.

headline: Apple’s AI Bet And India Manufacturing Shift Reshape Growth Narrative

These moves come as Apple, NasdaqGS:AAPL, works to scale iPhone production outside China and reposition its technology stack...

headline: Apple stock gains amid tech sell-off, Yum! Brands' mixed Q4 results
summary: Yahoo Finance Markets and Data Editor Jared Blikre and Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma track several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including Apple stock (AAPL) seeing gains despite a broader sell-off appearing in tech and software companies, Silicon Laboratories (SLAB) shares surging nearly 50% on news of its acquisition by Texas Instruments (TXN), and fast-food chain operator Yum! Brands (YUM) reporting mixed fourth quarter earnings results. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

content.title: Apple stock gains amid tech sell-off, Yum! Brands' mixed Q4 results
content.description:
Yahoo Finance Markets and Data Editor Jared Blikre and Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma track several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including Apple stock (AAPL) seeing gains despite a broader sell-off appearing in tech and software companies, Silicon Laboratories (SLAB) shares surging nearly 50% on news of its acquisition by Texas Instruments (TXN), and fast-food chain operator Yum! Brands (YUM) reporting mixed fourth quarter earnings results.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

content.summary: Although former Berkshire Hathaway (NYSE:BRK-B) CEO Warren Buffett retired as the company’s chief executive, his legacy looms large. For many years to come, adhering to Buffett’s value investing principles could keep you on the right financial path. Thus, even though Berkshire Hathaway isn’t operating under the guidance of Buffett anymore, you can still aim to ... 3 Warren Buffett-Style Stocks for a Golden Retirement

headline: Apple Beats Tech Stocks by Most in a Year as It Avoids AI Panic
summary: The move extends a recent trend, with Apple up nearly 6% to start this month, while the index is down 3.3%.  The gain has resulted in a market capitalization of just over $4 trillion for Apple, allowing it to squeak past Alphabet Inc. for the title for the second-largest company in the world, after Nvidia Corp.  “It doesn’t seem like the AI disruption theme is extending to hardware, which is certainly a positive at a time when the market has made the decision that AI is going to eat the entire software space,” said Dan Eye, chief investment officer at Fort Pitt Capital Group, which holds Apple shares in multiple portfolios.

content.title: Apple Beats Tech Stocks by Most in a Year as It Avoids AI Panic
content.summary: The move extends a recent trend, with Apple up nearly 6% to start this month, while the index is down 3.3%.  The gain has resulted in a market capitalization of just over $4 trillion for Apple, allowing it to squeak past Alphabet Inc. for the title for the second-largest company in the world, after Nvidia Corp.  “It doesn’t seem like the AI disruption theme is extending to hardware, which is certainly a positive at a time when the market has made the decision that AI is going to eat the entire software space,” said Dan Eye, chief investment officer at Fort Pitt Capital Group, which holds Apple shares in multiple portfolios.

headline: Google's quarterly results paint a picture of an internet powerhouse getting stronger in AI age
summary: Google’s latest quarterly report provided further evidence that its internet empire is withstanding an artificial intelligence shakeup that’s turning into another potential boon for the company.  The numbers released Wednesday marked Google's third consecutive quarter of digital ad growth of more than 10% from the previous year, while also posting more than 30% sales growth in its division that powers data centers for AI services.  The collective momentum of Google’s main business in search and advertising and the still-nascent AI field indicates a company born during the late 1990s internet boom is becoming even stronger during another technology phenomenon nearly 30 years later.

content.title: Google's quarterly results paint a picture of an internet powerhouse getting stronger in AI age

headline: Arm Holdings shares fall as licensing sales miss estimates
summary: Shares of Arm Holdings fell on Wednesday as its licensing revenues fell short of Wall Street estimates, despite a push by the company to boost the segment with new ​chip technology designs.  Arm shares were down about 8% in after-hours trading.  The company's miss on licensing revenues and results on Wednesday ‌from chip supplier Qualcomm - which expects a global memory supply shortage to hit mobile phone sales - pressured the stock, analysts said.

content.title: Arm Holdings shares fall as licensing sales miss estimates

Arm shares were down about 8% in after-hours trading.  The company's miss on licensing revenues and results on Wednesday ‌from chip supplier Qualcomm - which expects a global memory supply shortage to hit mobile phone sales - pressured the stock, analysts said.
